Ad Text:
I am partnering with a Queensland Government agency to recruit an experienced Data Governance Specialist to lead the establishment and implementation of data governance practices across the organisation.

This role will play a critical part in defining data ownership, formalising governance policies and procedures, and embedding data governance principles into both business operations and technical solutions. You will work closely with data professionals and business stakeholders to ensure data quality, integrity and compliance across the enterprise.

The contract runs through to 30 June 2026, with a strong potential for extension.

Key Responsibilities
Develop and formalise a comprehensive data governance policy and procedures
Establish and embed data ownership and accountability across the organisation
Onboard and train key roles including Data Stewards, Data Custodians and stakeholders
Ensure compliance with data governance standards covering data quality, lineage and integrity
Create clear documentation and training materials to support governance adoption
Collaborate with technical teams to ensure governance principles are embedded in data solutions
Skills & Experience

Essential:

Proven experience designing and implementing data governance frameworks, policies and procedures
Strong understanding of data governance principles including data quality, lineage and integrity
Experience onboarding and training data governance roles
Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working in highly regulated environments (e.g. insurance, financial services, government)
Desirable:

Familiarity with medallion architecture or equivalent data layering approaches
Exposure to Azure Databricks or cloud data platforms
This role is ideal for a data governance professional who enjoys building frameworks from the ground up and influencing data maturity at an enterprise level.

Apply now or reach out for a confidential discussion.

I am partnering with a Queensland Government agency to recruit an experienced PowerBI Developer to design and deliver high-quality dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights to support decision-making.

This is a hands-on contract role working closely with data professionals and business stakeholders to translate complex data into intuitive, user-friendly visualisations. You will play a key role in strengthening reporting and analytics capability across the organisation.

The initial contract runs through to 30 June 2026, with a strong potential for extension.

Key Responsibilities
Design and develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports aligned to data and analytics standards
Build and optimise semantic models and datasets to support effective reporting
Apply best-practice data visualisation principles to communicate insights clearly
Produce clear technical documentation covering data sources, measures and calculations
Support user acceptance testing (UAT) and refine solutions based on stakeholder feedback
Train and support business users in the effective use of Power BI reports and dashboards
Skills & Experience

Essential:

Proven experience developing Power BI dashboards and reports
Strong skills in SQL, DAX and Power Query
Solid understanding of data visualisation best practice
Experience building and managing semantic models
Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of data governance principles
Desirable:

Experience with medallion architecture (or equivalent data layering approaches)
Exposure to CI/CD and DevOps practices
Knowledge of Azure Databricks or cloud data platforms
Experience working in insurance, financial services or highly regulated environments
If youâ€™re a Power BI Developer who enjoys delivering meaningful insights and working closely with stakeholders in a data-driven environment, this contract is worth considering.

Apply now or reach out for a confidential discussion.
